pages.title: ℧ Page of Cups ℧
pages.text: Lotus of the Palace of Water$(br)      $(m)∇$() Earth of ∇ Water

A fair page of studious and intent aspect, contemplates their catch in a cup at the shore. They wear a beret on their head with a long flowing scarf.$(br)  Behind them the sea rolls shimmering with beauty, representing intuition, creativity and emotions.$(br)  A fish rises from the cup to look at them, signifying inspiration captured 'out of the blue'.$(br)  The concentration of Water does not judge, analyze, or put

things in categories; it simply experiences and apprehends.$(br)  This card signifies optimism and opportunity as the pictures of the mind take form.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Spending time allowing feelings or fantasies to flow into awareness, without judgment. Meditation.$(br)  It can represent someone imaginative, considerate, reflective.
$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Attachment, disappointment, indulging in obsession.$(br)  The need to think more clearly, make decisions or speak to others.
